item.title: Mandy add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Silence the pianos and with muffled drum Bring out the coffin, let the mourners come. Let aeroplanes circle moaning overhead Scribbling on the sky the message He Is Dead, Put crÃªpe bows round the white necks of the public doves, Let the traffic policemen wear black cotton gloves. He was my North, my South, my East and West, My working week and my Sunday rest, My noon, my midnight, my talk, my song; I thought that love would last for ever: I was wrong. The stars are not wanted now: put out every one; Pack up the moon and dismantle the sun; Pour away the ocean and sweep up the wood. For nothing now can ever come to any good." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Make it dark, make it grim, make it tough, but then, for the love of God, tell a joke." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Every fairy tale had a bloody lining. Every one had teeth and claws." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Mandy add a quote by W.B. Yeats
Mandy add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Mandy add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life." -- W. Somerset Maugham
